page.title: 01Welcome to Chelmsford.
page.content: {Chelmsford,}the county town of { {Essex,}stands at the confluence of the rivers,{Chelmer}and{Can,}and obviously derives its name from the former.There is evidence of a settlement dating from the Roman occupation and it is named in the Domesday Book as{ {Celmeresfort}and{Celmeresforde,}but there was no major development until the 16th century. The area covered by this survey lying to the north of the River Can faithfully mirrors the change from the quiet market town of the 19th century, through the introduction of light industry in the early days of the 20th century to the thriving commercial and dormitory town of the present age. This change has been inexorable and even now bulldozers are scything a giant swathe through the area to create a major new road.
